```{r}
pop <- readr::read_csv('data/population.csv', skip = 4, show_col_types = FALSE)
pop
```

```{r}
pop <- janitor::clean_names(pop)
pop
```

```{r}
pop <- dplyr::select(pop, -'indicator_name', -'indicator_code')
pop
```

```{r}
pop <- tidyr::pivot_longer(data = pop, cols = starts_with('x'),
                           names_to = 'year', names_prefix = 'x',
                           values_to = 'population')
pop
```

```{r}
pop <- dplyr::mutate(pop, year = as.integer(year))
pop
```

```{r}
pop <- read_csv('data/population.csv', skip = 4, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
    clean_names() %>%
    select(-'indicator_name', -'indicator_code') %>%
    pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('x'), names_to = 'year',
                 names_prefix = 'x', values_to = 'population') %>%
    mutate(year = as.integer(year))
pop
```

```{r}
read_world_bank_data <- function(file_path, variable_name) {
    df <- readr::read_csv(file_path, skip = 4, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
        janitor::clean_names() %>%
        dplyr::select(-'indicator_name', -'indicator_code') %>%
        tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = starts_with('x'), names_to = 'year',
                            names_prefix = 'x', values_to = variable_name) %>%
        dplyr::mutate(year = as.integer(year))
    return(df)
}
```

```{r}
gdp <- read_world_bank_data('data/gdp.csv', 'gdp')
gdp
```

```{r}
lexp <- read_world_bank_data('data/life_expectancy.csv', 'life_expectancy')
lexp
```

```{r}
merged <- dplyr::inner_join(pop, gdp, by = c('country_code', 'year'))
merged
```

```{r}
merged <- merged %>% dplyr::select(-country_name.y) %>%
    dplyr::rename(country_name = country_name.x) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(gdp_per_capita = gdp / population)
merged
```

```{r}
merged <- lexp %>% dplyr::select(-'country_name') %>%
    dplyr::inner_join(merged, ., by = c('country_code', 'year'))
merged
```

```{r}
regions <- readr::read_csv('data/regions.csv', show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
    janitor::clean_names()
regions
```

```{r}
help(countrycode)
```

```{r}
countrycode(c('United States of America', 'Estonia'),
            origin = 'country.name', destination = 'iso3c')
```

```{r}
countrycode(regions$country_name,
            origin = 'country.name', destination = 'iso3c')
```

```{r}
regions <- regions %>%
    mutate(country_code = countrycode(country_name, origin = 'country.name',
                                      destination = 'iso3c')) %>%
    select(-country_name)
regions
```

```{r}
merged <- inner_join(merged, regions, by = 'country_code') %>% drop_na()
merged
```

```{r}
data_2019 <- merged %>% filter(year == 2019)
data_2019
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point() +
    scale_x_log10()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = region_name, size = population)) +
    scale_x_log10()
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = region_name, size = population)) +
    scale_x_log10() +
    scale_size(range = c(1,10))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = region_name, size = population)) +
    scale_x_log10() +
    scale_size(range = c(1,10)) +
    geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = 'lm')
```

```{r}
plot <- ggplot(data_2019, aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = region_name, size = population)) +
    scale_x_log10() +
    scale_size(range = c(1,10)) +
    geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = 'lm', se = FALSE,
                color = 'black', linetype = 'dashed') +
    labs(title = 'Health and Wealth by Coutnry in 2019',
         x = 'GDP per Capita (USD)',
         y = 'Life Expectancy at Birth',
         color = 'Region',
         size = 'Population')
plot
```

```{r}
ggsave('plot.png', plot = plot, width = 7, height = 5, units = 'in', dpi = 300)
```

```{r warning=FALSE}
plot_ly(data_2019, x = ~gdp_per_capita, y = ~life_expectancy,
        color = ~region_name, text = ~country_name, size = ~population,
        type = 'scatter', mode = 'markers', sizes = c(5, 50),
        marker = list(symbol = 'circle', sizemode = 'diameter')) %>%
    layout(xaxis = list(type = 'log'))
```

```{r}
plotly::ggplotly(plot)
```

```{r}
animation_data <- merged %>%
    dplyr::group_by(country_code) %>%
    dplyr::filter(n() == 60)
animation_data
```

```{r message=FALSE}
animated_plot <- ggplot(animation_data,
                        aes(x = gdp_per_capita, y = life_expectancy)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = region_name, size = population)) +
    scale_x_log10() +
    scale_size(range = c(1,10)) +
    geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = 'lm', se = FALSE,
                color = 'black', linetype = 'dashed') +
    labs(title = 'Health and Wealth by Coutnry in {frame_time}',
         x = 'GDP per Capita (USD)',
         y = 'Life Expectancy at Birth',
         color = 'Region',
         size = 'Population') +
    transition_time(year) +
    ease_aes('linear')

# create animation out of animated plot recipe
animation <- gganimate::animate(animated_plot, duration = 15, width = 5, 
                                height = 5, units = 'in', res = 72)
```

```{r}
# display animation inline
knitr::include_graphics(animation)
```

```{r}
gganimate::anim_save('animation.gif', animation = animation)
```
